Summary: Regression Testing for Existing Login Flow
Description: Conduct regression tests to ensure that the existing login flow remains unaffected by the new password reset feature.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Existing login flow is tested for functionality.
No new issues are introduced in the login flow.
Regression test results are documented and reviewed.

Summary: Email One-Time Code for Password Reset
Description: Implement a feature that allows users to reset their password using a one-time code sent via email.
AcceptanceCriteria:
User receives a one-time code via email upon request.
The one-time code expires after 10 minutes.
User can reset password using a valid one-time code.

Description: Develop test cases for verifying the OTP functionality during password reset.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Positive test case: OTP is valid and password is reset.
Negative test case: OTP is expired and password reset fails.
Negative test case: OTP is invalid and password reset fails.

Summary: Rate Limiting for Password Reset Attempts
Description: Implement rate limiting to restrict the number of password reset attempts per user.
AcceptanceCriteria:
User can attempt password reset a maximum of 3 times per hour.
Attempts exceeding the limit are blocked.
User receives a notification when the rate limit is reached.

Summary: Audit Event for Successful Password Reset
Description: Log an audit event whenever a password is successfully reset.
AcceptanceCriteria:
An audit event is created upon successful password reset.
The audit event includes the user ID and timestamp.
The audit event is accessible in system logs.
